threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects signs of potential use of the WSMAN provider from uncommon processes locally and remote execution.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

match_context.values:
@{ScriptBlockText=$AGOPhGEfGWyPAlAxIqmsEtsCWf = Start-Job -ScriptBlock {
    $GLFxFaEssCpT = (Get-WmiObject -Class Win32_OperatingSystem).Caption
    $RmDIVaOwVgOaSVttUmPO = 'ff4fbe21-02b8-45f5-b5ab-42fa6a1cec01'
    $YhpkUJgDTkgTsgevTe = [System.Net.WebUtility]::UrlEncode($GLFxFaEssCpT)
    $GFNGIBICJBSVzlFwDVRIJGAw = Get-WmiObject Win32_ComputerSystem | Select-Object -ExpandProperty Domain
    $BEr = Get-WmiObject -Namespace "root\SecurityCenter2" -Class AntiVirusProduct
    $TnaqlKaTFFFlKWCgVYMhqDrSh = $ [TRUNCATED]; Path=C:\Users\george\Desktop\sample.ps1; ScriptBlockId=b491a018-8861-49cf-9b1e-d4f619b33c28; MessageTotal=1; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may employ various system checks to detect and avoid virtualization and analysis environments.
This may include changing behaviors based on the results of checks for the presence of artifacts indicative of a virtual machine environment (VME) or sandbox

match_context.values:
@{ScriptBlockText=$AGOPhGEfGWyPAlAxIqmsEtsCWf = Start-Job -ScriptBlock {
    $GLFxFaEssCpT = (Get-WmiObject -Class Win32_OperatingSystem).Caption
    $RmDIVaOwVgOaSVttUmPO = 'ff4fbe21-02b8-45f5-b5ab-42fa6a1cec01'
    $YhpkUJgDTkgTsgevTe = [System.Net.WebUtility]::UrlEncode($GLFxFaEssCpT)
    $GFNGIBICJBSVzlFwDVRIJGAw = Get-WmiObject Win32_ComputerSystem | Select-Object -ExpandProperty Domain
    $BEr = Get-WmiObject -Namespace "root\SecurityCenter2" -Class AntiVirusProduct
    $TnaqlKaTFFFlKWCgVYMhqDrSh = $ [TRUNCATED]; Path=C:\Users\george\Desktop\sample.ps1; ScriptBlockId=b491a018-8861-49cf-9b1e-d4f619b33c28; MessageTotal=1; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=1B3B40FBC889FD4C645CC12C85D0805AC36BA254,MD5=95000560239032BC68B4C2FDFCDEF913,SHA256=D3F8FADE829D2B7BD596C4504A6DAE5C034E789B6A3DEFBE013BDA7D14466677,IMPHASH=741776AACCFC5B71FF59832DCDCACE0F; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -noLogo -ExecutionPolicy unrestricted -file "C:\Users\george\Desktop\sample.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -Version 5.1 -s -NoLogo -NoProfile; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Finds PowerShell scripts used in a malvertising campaign to deliver NetSupport RAT
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Sekoia.io
